metadata.title: CVE-2017-5111 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 61.0.3163.79 forLinux, Windows, and Mac allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploitmemory corruption via a crafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378').
